refnamediv.refpurpose: Executes a call to a Scilab function(macro) in parallel

listitem.para: the function to evaluate in parallel. The function must take exactly one argument and return exactly one result. There is no limitation on the arg and result type, thus lists(records) can be used for multiple input/outputs.
a list of arguments. The function will be applied to each element of the list.

if the function depends on other user-defined functions. A file, containing all the functions definitions, must be provided. If the function doesn't depend on any user-defined function and only Scilab built-in functions, it is not mandatory.

This call will execute the given function in parallel through the ProActive Scheduler. The scheduler must be running and this Scilab session must be connected to it through a call to PAconnect. A single function is given in parameter, this function must have a single input and a single output e.g. y=f(x). The function's input and output can be of any type so records are possible to store multiple inputs/outputs.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: PAsolve(myfun, list(1,2,3,4,5,6)) // this will run myfun(1), myfun(2), myfun(3), etc.. on 6 different Scilab engines PAsolve(myfun, list(1,2,3,4,5,6), 'myfun/myfun.sci') // idem, but specifying a file where myfun is defined
